title: Chelsea star Callum Hudson-Odoi scores fine goal for England U21s vs Austria
text:
Callum Hudson-Odoi opened the scoring for England U21 against Austria in Milton Keynes (Picture: Getty)

Callum Hudson-Odoi offered further proof that he is fully behind his injury problems by scoring a fine opening goal for England U21s against Austria in Milton Keynes.

The 19-year-old has only just returned to action following almost six months on the sidelines after rupturing his Achilles tendon while playing for Chelsea against Burnley.

Hudson-Odoi has featured four times for Frank Lampard’s side since the end of September and his impressive form culminated in a call-up to Aidy Boothroyd’s U21 squad.

And the young winger showed just why he is so highly-regarded by both club and country by scoring an emphatic finish to put England in front against Austria in their Euro 2021 qualifier.

Brilliant from England, brilliant from Callum Hudson-Odoi! 😍 ∙ Perfect diagonal

∙ Pinpoint cross

∙ Ruthless volley The Young Lions get up and running in some style! 👏 pic.twitter.com/tQQOxK9wiW — Football on BT Sport (@btsportfootball) October 15, 2019

Bournemouth defender Lloyd Kelly started the move with a raking cross-field pass out to Norwich City’s full-back Max Aarons who turned a low ball into the penalty area.

Although Aarons’ cross came quickly and at an awkward height to Hudson-Odoi, the Chelsea winger controlled his finish expertly, sending the ball high into the roof of the net.

Arsenal striker Eddie Nketiah who is on loan at Leeds United this season, scored twice to put England 3-0 up before Hudson-Odoi added a sensational fourth in first-half stoppage time.

Collecting the ball just outside England’s penalty area, Hudson-Odoi stormed forward with the ball at his feet before bending an unstoppable shot into the corner of the net.

Those goals marked Hudson-Odoi’s first at U21 level and he has now scored three times in five games this season after netting in Chelsea’s 7-1 demolition of Grimsby Town in September.

Callum Hudson-Odoi, stop that. ⚡️⚡️⚡️ He's wasting absolutely no time on his return from injury! pic.twitter.com/ra9qVwuY4H — Football on BT Sport (@btsportfootball) October 15, 2019

Since the departure of Eden Hazard to Real Madrid, Hudson-Odoi has been tipped to become a key player as part of Lampard’s new-look Chelsea side alongside fellow academy graduates Mason Mount and Tammy Abraham.

Lampard is a big admirer of Hudson-Odoi’s talents but has challenged the youngster to work even harder to improve, citing Manchester City’s Raheem Sterling as the perfect role model to learn from.

Frank Lampard believes Callum Hudson-Odoi should model his game on Raheem Sterling (Picture: Getty)

Lampard said last month: ‘I don’t like to talk about other club’s players but Raheem Sterling is an incredible example of a player with great talent, whose work ethic added to that talent and improvement in a short period of time through absolute dedication, has seen him become a complete player, who we are all wowed by.

‘He is a great model for Callum because Callum has those talents. I want him to be the absolute best because he has the potential to do that and some of it is about hard truths and I saw some hard truths in the game the other day – ways that he can improve.’

Hudson-Odoi started his first Premier League game of the season against Southampton prior to the international break and will be hoping for another appearance against Newcastle United on Saturday.
